description: Trilogy operates coding bootcamps in partnership with universities—later acquired by education company 2U (now part of edX) in 2019 for $750 million. Offers non-credit, on-campus bootcamps in subjects like full-stack web development, data analytics, UX/UI design, and fintech—across ~50 university partners, serving ~20,000 students. Operates under 2U/edX's umbrella as a workforce accelerator, connecting education with employer needs.
achievements: Taught core web technologies including HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React, Node.js, and databases through lectures, code reviews, and live debugging sessions.
Mentored students one-on-one and in groups, helping them overcome coding challenges and develop problem-solving strategies.
Fostered a collaborative learning environment, promoting pair programming, code walkthroughs, and agile practices to simulate real-world workflows.
